verses.text: Now the \w word|strong="H1697"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came unto \w Jonah|strong="H3124"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Amittai|strong="H0573"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*,\f + \fr 1.1 \ft Jonah: Gr. Jonas\f*

\w Arise|strong="H6965"\w*, \w go|strong="H3212"\w* to \w Nineveh|strong="H5210"\w*, that \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, and \w cry|strong="H7121"\w* against it; for their \w wickedness|strong="H7451"\w* is come \w up|strong="H5927"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* me.

But \w Jonah|strong="H3124"\w* rose \w up|strong="H6965"\w* to \w flee|strong="H1272"\w* unto \w Tarshish|strong="H8659"\w* from the \w presence|strong="H6440"\w* of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and went \w down|strong="H3381"\w* to \w Joppa|strong="H3305"\w*; and he \w found|strong="H4672"\w* a \w ship|strong="H0591"\w* \w going|strong="H0935"\w* to \w Tarshish|strong="H8659"\w*: so he \w paid|strong="H5414"\w* the \w fare|strong="H7939"\w* thereof, and went \w down|strong="H3381"\w* into it, to \w go|strong="H0935"\w* with them unto \w Tarshish|strong="H8659"\w* from the \w presence|strong="H6440"\w* of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.

¶ But the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* sent \w out|strong="H2904"\w* a \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \w wind|strong="H7307"\w* into the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*, and there was a \w mighty|strong="H1419"\w* \w tempest|strong="H5591"\w* in the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*, so that the \w ship|strong="H0591"\w* was \w like|strong="H2803"\w* to be \w broken|strong="H7665"\w*.\f + \fr 1.4 \ft sent out: Heb. cast forth\f*\f + \fr 1.4 \ft was like…: Heb. thought to be broken\f*

Then the \w mariners|strong="H4419"\w* were \w afraid|strong="H3372"\w*, and \w cried|strong="H2199"\w* every \w man|strong="H0376"\w* unto his \w god|strong="H0430"\w*, and cast \w forth|strong="H2904"\w* the \w wares|strong="H3627"\w* that \add were\add* in the \w ship|strong="H0591"\w* into the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*, to \w lighten|strong="H7043"\w* \add it\add* of them. But \w Jonah|strong="H3124"\w* was gone \w down|strong="H3381"\w* into the \w sides|strong="H3411"\w* of the \w ship|strong="H5600"\w*; and he \w lay|strong="H7901"\w*, and was fast \w asleep|strong="H7290"\w*.

So the \w shipmaster|strong="H7227"\w* \w came|strong="H7126"\w* to him, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto him, What meanest thou, O \w sleeper|strong="H7290"\w*? \w arise|strong="H6965"\w*, \w call|strong="H7121"\w* upon thy \w God|strong="H0430"\w*, if so be that \w God|strong="H0430"\w* will \w think|strong="H6245"\w* upon us, that we \w perish|strong="H0006"\w* not.

And they \w said|strong="H0559"\w* every \w one|strong="H0376"\w* to his \w fellow|strong="H7453"\w*, \w Come|strong="H3212"\w*, and let us \w cast|strong="H5307"\w* \w lots|strong="H1486"\w*, that we may \w know|strong="H3045"\w* for whose \w cause|strong="H7945"\w* this \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* \add is\add* upon us. So they \w cast|strong="H5307"\w* \w lots|strong="H1486"\w*, and the \w lot|strong="H1486"\w* \w fell|strong="H5307"\w* upon \w Jonah|strong="H3124"\w*.

Then \w said|strong="H0559"\w* they unto him, \w Tell|strong="H5046"\w* us, we pray thee, for whose cause this \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* \add is\add* upon us; What \add is\add* thine \w occupation|strong="H4399"\w*? and \w whence|strong="H0370"\w* \w comest|strong="H0935"\w* thou? what \add is\add* thy \w country|strong="H0776"\w*? and of what \w people|strong="H5971"\w* \add art\add* thou?

And he \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto them, I \add am\add* an \w Hebrew|strong="H5680"\w*; and I \w fear|strong="H3373"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, the \w God|strong="H0430"\w* of \w heaven|strong="H8064"\w*, which hath \w made|strong="H6213"\w* the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w* and the \w dry|strong="H3004"\w* \add land\add*.\f + \fr 1.9 \ft the \+nd LORD\+nd*: or, \+nd JEHOVAH\+nd*\f*

Then were the \w men|strong="H0582"\w* \w exceedingly|strong="H1419"\w* \w afraid|strong="H3372"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto him, Why hast thou \w done|strong="H6213"\w* this? For the \w men|strong="H0582"\w* \w knew|strong="H3045"\w* that he \w fled|strong="H1272"\w* from the \w presence|strong="H6440"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, because he had \w told|strong="H5046"\w* them.\f + \fr 1.10 \ft exceedingly…: Heb. with great fear\f*

¶ Then \w said|strong="H0559"\w* they unto him, What shall we \w do|strong="H6213"\w* unto thee, that the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w* may be \w calm|strong="H8367"\w* unto us? for the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w* \w wrought|strong="H1980"\w*, and was \w tempestuous|strong="H5590"\w*.\f + \fr 1.11 \ft may…: Heb. may be silent from us\f*\f + \fr 1.11 \ft wrought…: or, grew more and more tempestuous: Heb. went\f*

And he \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto them, Take me \w up|strong="H5375"\w*, and cast me \w forth|strong="H2904"\w* into the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*; so shall the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w* be \w calm|strong="H8367"\w* unto you: for I \w know|strong="H3045"\w* that for my \w sake|strong="H7945"\w* this \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \w tempest|strong="H5591"\w* \add is\add* upon you.

Nevertheless the \w men|strong="H0582"\w* rowed \w hard|strong="H2864"\w* to \w bring|strong="H7725"\w* \add it\add* to the \w land|strong="H3004"\w*; but they \w could|strong="H3201"\w* not: for the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w* \w wrought|strong="H1980"\w*, and was \w tempestuous|strong="H5590"\w* against them.\f + \fr 1.13 \ft rowed: Heb. digged\f*\f + \fr 1.13 \ft wrought…: or, grew more and more tempestuous: Heb. went\f*

Wherefore they \w cried|strong="H7121"\w* unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, We beseech \w thee|strong="H0577"\w*, O 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, we beseech thee, let us not \w perish|strong="H0006"\w* for this \w man’s|strong="H0376"\w* \w life|strong="H5315"\w*, and \w lay|strong="H5414"\w* not upon us \w innocent|strong="H5355"\w* \w blood|strong="H1818"\w*: for thou, O 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, hast \w done|strong="H6213"\w* as it \w pleased|strong="H2654"\w* thee.

So they took \w up|strong="H5375"\w* \w Jonah|strong="H3124"\w*, and cast him \w forth|strong="H2904"\w* into the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*: and the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w* \w ceased|strong="H5975"\w* from her \w raging|strong="H2197"\w*.\f + \fr 1.15 \ft ceased: Heb. stood\f*

Then the \w men|strong="H0582"\w* \w feared|strong="H3372"\w* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* \w exceedingly|strong="H1419"\w*, and \w offered|strong="H2076"\w* a \w sacrifice|strong="H2077"\w* unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and \w made|strong="H5087"\w* \w vows|strong="H5088"\w*.  +  r 1.16  t offered…: Heb. sacrifice unto the \+nd LORD\+nd*, and vowed vows *

¶ Now the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* had \w prepared|strong="H4487"\w* a \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \w fish|strong="H1709"\w* to swallow \w up|strong="H1104"\w* \w Jonah|strong="H3124"\w*. And \w Jonah|strong="H3124"\w* was in the \w belly|strong="H4578"\w* of the \w fish|strong="H1709"\w* \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w days|strong="H3117"\w* and \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w nights|strong="H3915"\w*.\f + \fr 1.17 \ft belly: Heb. bowels\f*
